entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 23 at 9:01AM AKDT until July 25 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: The ash from the eruption of Shishaldin Volcano overnight has moved away from the Alaska Peninsula. No further ashfall from that eruption is expected. However, Shishaldin volcano remains active and could erupt again at any time.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alaska Peninsula

entry.summary: ...Very Hot Over The Eastern Interior Through Monday... ...High Water On The Tanana River Into Next Week... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:58PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Floyd and eastern Carroll Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dugspur to near Gladesboro to near Fancy Gap. Movement was east-northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy
entry.cap:areaDesc: Carroll; Floyd

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:55PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Alleghany, northeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina and southeastern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 145 PM EDT... At 1253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Twin Oaks, or near Sparta, moving east at 20 mph.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued July 23 at 4:02AM PDT until July 24 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS MONDAY... .A cold front will approach Monday afternoon and sweep through Monday night. Southwest winds will increase through the day becoming gusty Monday afternoon and evening with gusts of 25 to 35 mph. Temperatures Monday afternoon will climb into the upper 80s to low 90s with RH values in the teens to lower twenties.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Columbia Basin, Palouse, Spokane Area; Foothills of Northeast Washington; Lower Palouse, Snake River
